Hello Forgot your PIN? PIN is incorrect. The number of attempts left: %s\nTry again or click the forgotten password button.
Create password To better protect your app avoid using consecutive numbers, repeating digits, your date of birth, or your phone number. Your password is too simple. Use different numbers to create a stronger one. Don\'t use sequential numbers. It\'s too easy to guess. Make a stronger password. Don\'t use repeating digits more than twice. It\'s too easy to guess. Make a stronger password. Don\'t use your birthday. It\'s too easy to guess. Make a stronger password. Don\'t use any part of your phone number. It\'s too easy to guess. Make a stronger password. You\'ve already used this combination for a password. Please create a new one.
Confirm password Enter your password one more time to be sure it\'s correct. Your password does not match the one you provided earlier.
Enable biometrics Would you like to enable biometric login? You can turn on biometrics for faster transactions and in-app actions. Set it up later Enable

Български English
Active Invalid Stopped Signed Created Revoked Expired
Paid Denied Signed Approved Submitted Completed Processing Pending payment Payment expired Pending signature Stored certificate Generated certificate
<p>This portal allows you to create a user profile using an email address, a password and your name as it appears on your identity document. The password must be eight characters long and contain at least two letters, one of which must be capitalized, a number and a special symbol. Through the created unique user profile, you have access to:</p><ul><li><p>View data and add authentication means to the profile</p></li><li><p>Request electronic administrative services</p></li><li><p>View status of services requested by you</p></li><li><p>View payments made</p></li><li><p>History of events in the system</p></li><li><p>Manage notifications</p></li></ul> <p><strong>Filling out a new empowerment statement  </strong>- At this stage, you need to complete the information for the empowerment:</p><p><strong>Applicant data</strong>:</p><ul><li><p><strong>On behalf of</strong>: You can choose one of the following options:<br/>*“Individual” - to issue a new empowerment on your behalf.<br/>*"Legal entity" - to issue a new empowerment on behalf of a legal entity you are part of.</p></li></ul> <p><strong>Filling out an authorization statement </strong>- Fill in the authorization information:</p><p><strong>Applicant details:</strong></p><ul><li><p><strong>On behalf of:</strong> Select the “Individual” option to issue a statement on your behalf.</p></li></ul><p><strong>Authorized persons:</strong></p><ul><li><p><strong>Identifier:</strong> Select a Personal Identification Number (PIN) or a Personal Foreign Number (LNCh).</p></li><li><p><strong>Authorized person’s PIN/LNch:</strong> Enter valid data for the individuals you wish to authorize</p></li></ul><p>*You can authorize more than one person using the “Add Authorized Person +” button.</p><p><strong>Authorization:</strong></p><ul><li><p><strong>Authorization type:</strong> When more than one authorized person is added, the “Authorization Type” field appears, in which you must select whether the authorized persons will be able to use the authorization “Only together” or “Separately”:</p></li></ul><p>*With “Only together”, one authorization is created, which must be signed by you. The authorization can only be used when the authorized persons identify themselves to the Electronic Administrative Services Provider together.</p><p>*With “Separately”, as many authorizations are created as there are authorized persons. Each authorization is signed separately.</p><ul><li><p><strong>Service Provider:</strong> Select the provider of the service for which you want the authorization to be valid.</p></li><li><p><strong>Service:</strong> Select a service that the authorized person can perform on your behalf.</p></li><li><p><strong>Scope of the representative authority:</strong> Select the scope of the representative authority for the specific service.</p></li><li><p><strong>Start date:</strong> Select the date from which the authorization will enter into force.</p></li><li><p><strong>End date:</strong> Select the date until which the authorization will be valid.</p></li></ul><p><strong>*Important!:</strong> If no end date is specified, the authorization automatically becomes indefinite.</p><p><strong>Submitting the authorization statement </strong>- Carefully check the information entered, make sure that all data is correct and submit the statement.</p><ul><li><p>After successfully submitting an authorization statement, it will be visible in the "Authorizations from me" section with the status "Sign".</p></li><li><p>To complete the process of submitting the new authorization, you must follow the steps for signing with a Qualified Electronic Signature.</p></li></ul> <p><strong>Filling out a new empowerment statement  </strong>- At this stage, you need to complete the information for the empowerment:</p><p><strong>Applicant data:</strong></p><ul><li><p><strong>On behalf of:  </strong>Select the "Legal entity" option to issue a statement on behalf of the legal entity you are part of.</p></li><li><p><strong>As:  </strong>Fill in the position you hold within the legal entity.</p></li><li><p><strong>EIC/Bulstat of the legal entity:</strong> Enter a valid EIC/BULSTAT of the legal entity.</p></li><li><p><strong>Legal Entity Name:</strong> Fill in the name of the legal entity.</p></li></ul><p><strong>Legal Representatives:</strong></p><ul><li><p><strong>Identifier:</strong> Select either EGN (<em>*for Bulgarian citizens only</em>) or  LNCH.</p></li><li><p><strong>EGN/LNCH of legal representative:</strong> Enter a valid Uniform civil number (EGN) or Personal foreigner number (LNCH) (depending on the selected identifier);</p></li><li><p><strong>Names of legal representative:</strong> Fill in the full name of the legal representative as per their ID card in Bulgarian.  </p></li></ul><p><strong>*Important!:</strong> If the representation of the legal entity is “Jointly” or “In Another Manner,” you must provide the details for each legal representative who has the right to authorize. You can add additional fields by using the “Add legal representatives +” button.</p><p><strong>Empowered persons:</strong></p><ul><li><p><strong>Identifier:</strong> Select either EGN (<em>*for Bulgarian citizens only</em>) or  LNCH.</p></li><li><p><strong>EGN/LNCH number of the <span>empowered  </span>person:  </strong>Enter details about the person/s you wish to empower. You must provide their valid Uniform civil number (EGN) or Personal foreigner number (LNCH) (depending on the selected identifier);</p></li></ul><p>*In case you want to empower more than one person, you can add more fields for empowered persons using the "Add empowered person +" button.</p><p><strong>Empowerment:</strong></p><ul><li><p><strong>Empowerment type:  </strong>When more than one empowered person is added, the "<strong>Empowerment type</strong>" field appears, in which you must choose whether the empowered persons will be able to use  power of attorney "Together Only" or "Separately":</p></li></ul><p>*For the"Together Only" option, a single empowerment is generated, which you must sign. Accordingly, it can only be used when the two empowered persons identify themselves before DEAU together.</p><p>*For the  "Separately" option,  a separate empowerment is generated for each entered proxy. Each empowerment is signed separately and is valid independently.</p><ul><li><p><strong>Service Provider:  </strong>Select the service provider for which you want the empowerment to be valid.</p></li><li><p><strong>Service:</strong> Specify the service for which you wish to authorize the selected individuals to act on your behalf.</p></li><li><p><strong>Extent of representative authority:</strong> Choose the extent of their representative authority.</p></li><li><p><strong>Start Date:  </strong>Select the date from which the empowerment will take effect.</p></li><li><p><strong>End Date:</strong> Indicate the date until which the authorization will be valid.</p></li></ul><p><strong>*Important!:</strong> If no end date is specified, the empowerment automatically becomes indefinite.</p><ul><li><p><strong>Review and Submit:  </strong>After completing the empowerment, press the "Review and Submit" button to review the final document.</p></li></ul><p><strong>Submission of the empowerment statement  </strong>- Carefully check the entered information, and make sure that all the data is correct. If everything is fine, press "Submit a statement":</p><ul><li><p>After pressing the button, a window will appear with a warning that the statement will be submitted, press "Submit".</p></li><li><p>Upon successful submission, the new empowerment statement will be visible in the "From me" section with the status "Sign". To complete the process of submitting the new empowerment, you must follow the steps to sign with a Qualified Electronic Signature (QES) or a Cloud Qualified Electronic Signature (CQES).</p></li></ul> <p>1. To use your phone as a reader, please make sure it has an NFC scanner and turn it on.</p><p>2. Establish the exact position of the reader.</p><p>3. Press the document firmly without moving it and do not remove it while the reading processes are in progress.</p> <p><strong>Attention!</strong></p><p>Please, when changing names, enter the data from a Bulgarian identity document in order to be able to use the online services of the Centralized Electronic Identification System.</p> <p>On this screen, you can set your preferences for receiving notifications, which are sent by default to the email address specified in the profile. The system offers the option of choosing alternative communication channels, providing flexibility and convenience. You have control over some of the notifications, as you can activate or deactivate them. Certain system notifications are mandatory and cannot be changed, as they are of critical importance for your security when using the services in the system. They have a protective function that allows you to react immediately in the event of a suspicious event or action.</p> <p>The Register of Authorizations is:</p><ul><li><p>  An electronic database containing information on authorizations in the exercise of rights before a state body, an organization providing public services, and persons performing public functions.</p></li><li><p>  Only an individual with registration in the Citizens\' Portal and an electronic identity associated with the profile can be authorized.</p></li><li><p>  Authorization is carried out by signing an authorization statement with a qualified electronic signature.</p></li><li><p>  The authorizing party indicates the actions for which he grants rights to the authorized party and the term of the authorization.</p></li><li><p>  Authorization on behalf of a legal entity can only be carried out by its legal representative.</p></li></ul> <p>The process of issuing an Electronic Identity Certificate begins with submitting an application. This can be done both electronically and through an Electronic Identity Administrator (EIA).</p><ul><li><p>  An electronic identity certificate is issued if the person has appeared in person at an administrative service center of the Ministry of Interior or an EIA office.</p></li><li><p>  An electronic identity certificate for a minor or a person under guardianship is issued if the following requirements are met:\n  1.  The application is submitted only in person.<br>  2.  The application is also signed by a parent, respectively a guardian or custodian.<br>  3.  A parent, respectively a guardian or custodian has appeared in person and presented a valid identity document.</p></li><li><p>  The electronic identity certificate is issued with a validity period of 5 years.</p></li><li><p>  The electronic identity certificate is recorded only on an electronic medium that meets the requirements set out in the Regulations for the Implementation of the Electronic Identification Act.</p></li><li><p>  The electronic identity certificate is entered in the Register of Electronic Identity Certificates.</p></li><li><p>  The certificate holder is handed over personally to its holder, and exceptionally - to an authorized person, after presenting a notarized express power of attorney.</p></li><li><p>  When the application for issuance of a certificate is submitted through an electronic identity administrator other than the Ministry of Interior, the relations between it and the person are regulated by a contract.</p></li><li><p>  Foreigners with a permit for prolonged, permanent or long-term residence in the Republic of Bulgaria should visit in person the Directorate of Migration - Ministry of Interior, Department/Sector/Group "Migration" at the Directorate of Internal Affairs and the Directorate of Internal Affairs at the address of residence to submit an application for issuance of an electronic identity certificate.</p></li></ul>

Filing a statement Before confirming the submission of a new perpetual empowerment, please consider the following risks:: No automatic termination: The indefinite empowerment is valid until it is withdrawn by you or until the empowered person declares disagreement with it. Increased risk of unauthorized actions: With an indefinite empowerment, there is a risk that you may forget that its action is valid and it could be used for malicious purposes. Exposure to security risks: Perpetual empowerment can give your authorized individuals continued access to your information or assets, which can increase the risk of fraud or abuse. Your statement will be processed as soon as possible. Please sign it on the "From me" page.
